   20: 
   21: -module(persistent_term_SUITE).
   22: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0,suite/0,init_per_suite/1,end_per_suite/1,
   25: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   26: 	 basic/1,purging/1,sharing/1,get_trapping/1,
   27:          destruction/1,
   28:          get_all_race/1,
   29:          info/1,info_trapping/1,killed_while_trapping/1,
   30:          off_heap_values/1,keys/1,collisions/1,
   31:          init_restart/1, put_erase_trapping/1,
   32:          killed_while_trapping_put/1,
   33:          killed_while_trapping_erase/1,
   34:          error_info/1,
   35: 	 whole_message/1,
   36:          shared_magic_ref/1,
   37: 	 non_message_signal/1,
   38:          get_put_colliding_bucket/1]).
   39: 
   40: %%
   41: -export([test_init_restart_cmd/1]).
   42: 
   43: suite() ->
   44:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   45:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   46: 
   47: all() ->
   48:     [basic,purging,sharing,get_trapping,info,info_trapping,
   49:      destruction,
   50:      get_all_race,
   51:      killed_while_trapping,off_heap_values,keys,collisions,
   52:      init_restart, put_erase_trapping, killed_while_trapping_put,
   53:      killed_while_trapping_erase,
   54:      error_info,
   55:      whole_message,
   56:      shared_magic_ref,
   57:      non_message_signal,
   58:      get_put_colliding_bucket].
   59: 
   60: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   61:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   62:     %% Put a term in the dict so that we know that the testcases handle
   63:     %% stray terms left by stdlib or other test suites.
   64:     persistent_term:put(init_per_suite, {?MODULE}),
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   68:     persistent_term:erase(init_per_suite),
   69:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, false),
   70:     Config.
   71: 
   72: init_per_testcase(_, Config) ->
   73:     Config.
   74: 
   75: end_per_testcase(get_all_race, _Config) ->
   76:     get_all_race_cleanup(),
   77:     ok;
   78: end_per_testcase(_, _Config) ->
   79:     ok.
   80: 
   81: basic(_Config) ->
   82:     Chk = chk(),
   83:     N = 777,
   84:     Seq = lists:seq(1, N),
   85:     par(2, N, Seq, Chk),
   86:     seq(3, Seq, Chk),
   87:     seq(3, Seq, Chk),                                %Same values.
   88:     _ = [begin
   89:              Key = {?MODULE,{key,I}},
   90:              true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
   91:              false = persistent_term:erase(Key),
   92:              {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key)),
   93:              {not_present,Key} = persistent_term:get(Key, {not_present,Key})
   94:          end || I <- Seq],
   95:     [] = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
   96:     chk(Chk).
   97: 
   98: par(C, N, Seq, Chk) ->
   99:     _ = [spawn_link(fun() ->
  100:                             ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{key,I}},
  101:                                                      {value,C*I})
  102:                     end) || I <- Seq],
  103:     Result = wait(N, Chk),
  104:     _ = [begin
  105:              Double = C*I,
  106:              {{?MODULE,{key,I}},{value,Double}} = Res
  107:          end || {I,Res} <- lists:zip(Seq, Result)],
  108:     ok.
  109: 
  110: seq(C, Seq, Chk) ->
  111:     _ = [ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{key,I}}, {value,C*I}) ||
  112:             I <- Seq],
  113:     All = pget(Chk),
  114:     All = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- All],
  115:     All = [{Key,persistent_term:get(Key)} || {Key,_} <- All],
  116:     Result = lists:sort(All),
  117:     _ = [begin
  118:              Double = C*I,
  119:              {{?MODULE,{key,I}},{value,Double}} = Res
  120:          end || {I,Res} <- lists:zip(Seq, Result)],
  121:     ok.
  122: 
  123: wait(N, Chk) ->
  124:     All = [P || {{?MODULE,_},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
  125:     case length(All) of
  126:         N ->
  127:             All = [{Key,persistent_term:get(Key)} || {Key,_} <- All],
  128:             lists:sort(All);
  129:         _ ->
  130:             receive after 10 -> ok end,
  131:             wait(N, Chk)
  132:     end.
  133: 
  134: %% Make sure that terms that have been erased are copied into all
  135: %% processes that still hold a pointer to them.
  136: 
  137: purging(_Config) ->
  138:     Chk = chk(),
  139:     do_purging(fun(K) -> persistent_term:put(K, {?MODULE,new}) end,
  140:                replaced),
  141:     do_purging(fun persistent_term:erase/1, erased),
  142:     chk(Chk).
  143: 
  144: do_purging(Eraser, Type) ->
  145:     Parent = self(),
  146:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  147:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, {term,[<<"abc",0:777/unit:8>>]}),
  148:     Ps0 = [spawn_monitor(fun() -> purging_tester(Parent, Key) end) ||
  149:               _ <- lists:seq(1, 50)],
  150:     Ps = maps:from_list(Ps0),
  151:     purging_recv(gotten, Ps),
  152:     Eraser(Key),
  153:     _ = [P ! {Parent,Type} || P <- maps:keys(Ps)],
  154:     purging_wait(Ps).
  155: 
  156: purging_recv(Tag, Ps) when map_size(Ps) > 0 ->
  157:     receive
  158:         {Pid,Tag} ->
  159:             true = is_map_key(Pid, Ps),
  160:             purging_recv(Tag, maps:remove(Pid, Ps))
  161:     end;
  162: purging_recv(_, _) -> ok.
  163: 
  164: purging_wait(Ps) when map_size(Ps) > 0 ->
  165:     receive
  166:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,Reason} ->
  167:             normal = Reason,
  168:             Ref = map_get(Pid, Ps),
  169:             purging_wait(maps:remove(Pid, Ps))
  170:     end;
  171: purging_wait(_) -> ok.
  172: 
  173: purging_tester(Parent, Key) ->
  174:     Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  175:     purging_check_term(Term),
  176:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Term),
  177:     Parent ! {self(),gotten},
  178:     receive
  179:         {Parent,erased} ->
  180:             {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key)),
  181:             purging_tester_1(Term, 1);
  182:         {Parent,replaced} ->
  183:             {?MODULE,new} = persistent_term:get(Key),
  184:             purging_tester_1(Term, 1)
  185:     end.
  186: 
  187: %% Wait for the term to be copied into this process.
  188: purging_tester_1(Term, Timeout) ->
  189:     purging_check_term(Term),
  190:     receive after Timeout -> ok end,
  191:     case erts_debug:size_shared(Term) of
  192:         0 ->
  193:             case Timeout of
  194:                 1000 ->
  195:                     flush_later_ops(),
  196:                     purging_tester_1(Term, 1);
  197:                 _ ->
  198:                     purging_tester_1(Term, Timeout*10)
  199:             end;
  200:         Size ->
  201:             %% The term has been copied into this process.
  202:             purging_check_term(Term),
  203:             Size = erts_debug:size(Term)
  204:     end.
  205: 
  206: purging_check_term({term,[<<"abc",0:777/unit:8>>]}) ->
  207:     ok.
  208: 
  209: %% Make sure terms are really deallocated when overwritten or erased.
  210: destruction(Config) ->
  211:     ok = erts_test_destructor:init(Config),
  212: 
  213:     NKeys = 100,
  214:     Keys = lists:seq(0,NKeys-1),
  215:     [begin
  216:          V = erts_test_destructor:send(self(), K),
  217:          persistent_term:put({?MODULE,K}, V)
  218:      end
  219:      || K <- Keys],
  220: 
  221:     %% Erase or overwrite all keys in "random" order.
  222:     lists:foldl(fun(_, K) ->
  223:                         case erlang:phash2(K) band 1 of
  224:                             0 ->
  225:                                 %%io:format("erase key ~p\n", [K]),
  226:                                 persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,K});
  227:                             1 ->
  228:                                 %%io:format("replace key ~p\n", [K]),
  229:                                 persistent_term:put({?MODULE,K}, value)
  230:                         end,
  231:                         (K + 13) rem NKeys
  232:                 end,
  233:                 17, Keys),
  234: 
  235:     destruction_1(Keys).
  236: 
  237: destruction_1(Keys) ->
  238:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  239: 
  240:     %% Receive all destruction messages
  241:     MsgLst = destruction_recv(length(Keys), [], 2),
  242:     ok = case lists:sort(MsgLst) of
  243:              Keys ->
  244:                  ok;
  245:              _ ->
  246:                  io:format("GOT ~p\n", [MsgLst]),
  247:                  io:format("MISSING ~p\n", [Keys -- MsgLst]),
  248:                  error
  249:          end,
  250: 
  251:     %% Cleanup all remaining
  252:     [persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,K}) || K <- Keys],
  253:     ok.
  254: 
  255: destruction_recv(0, Acc, _) ->
  256:     Acc;
  257: destruction_recv(N, Acc, Flush) ->
  258:     receive M ->
  259:             destruction_recv(N-1, [M | Acc], Flush)
  260:     after 1000 ->
  261:             io:format("TIMEOUT. Missing ~p destruction messages.\n", [N]),
  262:             case Flush of
  263:                 0 ->
  264:                     Acc;
  265:                 _ ->
  266:                     io:format("Try flush last literal area cleanup...\n"),
  267:                     flush_later_ops(),
  268:                     destruction_recv(N, Acc, Flush-1)
  269:             end
  270:     end.
  271: 
  272: %% Both persistent_term itself and erts_literal_are_collector use
  273: %% erts_schedule_thr_prgr_later_cleanup_op() to schedule purge and deallocation
  274: %% of literals. To avoid waiting forever on sleeping schedulers we flush
  275: %% all later ops to make these cleanup jobs go through.
  276: flush_later_ops() ->
  277:     try
  278:         erts_debug:set_internal_state(wait, thread_progress)
  279:     catch
  280:         error:system_limit ->
  281:             ok % already ongoing; called by other process
  282:     end,
  283:     ok.
  284: 
  285: 
  286: %% Test that sharing is preserved when storing terms.
  287: 
  288: sharing(_Config) ->
  289:     Chk = chk(),
  290:     Depth = 10,
  291:     Size = 2*Depth,
  292:     Shared = lists:foldl(fun(_, A) -> [A|A] end,
  293:                          [], lists:seq(1, Depth)),
  294:     Size = erts_debug:size(Shared),
  295:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  296:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Shared),
  297:     SharedStored = persistent_term:get(Key),
  298:     Size = erts_debug:size(SharedStored),
  299:     0 = erts_debug:size_shared(SharedStored),
  300: 
  301:     {Pid,Ref} = spawn_monitor(fun() ->
  302:                                       Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  303:                                       Size = erts_debug:size(Term),
  304:                                       0 = erts_debug:size_shared(Term),
  305:                                       true = Term =:= SharedStored
  306:                               end),
  307:     receive
  308:         {'DOWN',Ref,process,Pid,normal} ->
  309:             true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  310:             Size = erts_debug:size(SharedStored),
  311:             chk(Chk)
  312:     end.
  313: 
  314: %% Test trapping of persistent_term:get/0.
  315: 
  316: get_trapping(_Config) ->
  317:     Chk = chk(),
  318: 
  319:     %% Assume that the get/0 traps after 4000 iterations
  320:     %% in a non-debug emulator.
  321:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  322:             1 -> 10000;
  323:             _ -> 1000
  324:         end,
  325:     spawn_link(fun() -> get_trapping_create(N) end),
  326:     All = do_get_trapping(N, [], Chk),
  327:     N = get_trapping_check_result(lists:sort(All), 1),
  328:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  329:     get_trapping_erase(N),
  330:     chk(Chk).
  331: 
  332: do_get_trapping(N, Prev, Chk) ->
  333:     case pget(Chk) of
  334:         Prev when length(Prev) >= N ->
  335:             All = [P || {{?MODULE,{get_trapping,_}},_}=P <- Prev],
  336:             case length(All) of
  337:                 N -> All;
  338:                 _ -> do_get_trapping(N, Prev, Chk)
  339:             end;
  340:         New ->
  341:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
  342:             do_get_trapping(N, New, Chk)
  343:     end.
  344: 
  345: get_trapping_create(0) ->
  346:     ok;
  347: get_trapping_create(N) ->
  348:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}}, N),
  349:     get_trapping_create(N-1).
  350: 
  351: get_trapping_check_result([{{?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}},N}|T], N) ->
  352:     get_trapping_check_result(T, N+1);
  353: get_trapping_check_result([], N) -> N-1.
  354: 
  355: get_trapping_erase(0) ->
  356:     ok;
  357: get_trapping_erase(N) ->
  358:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{get_trapping,N}}),
  359:     get_trapping_erase(N-1).
  360: 
  361: %% Test retrieving information about persistent terms.
  362: 
  363: info(_Config) ->
  364:     Chk = chk(),
  365: 
  366:     %% White box test of info/0.
  367:     N = 100,
  368:     try
  369:         Overhead = info_literal_area_overhead(),
  370:         io:format("Overhead = ~p\n", [Overhead]),
  371:         info_wb(N, Overhead, info_info())
  372:     after
  373:         _ = [_ = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,I}) ||
  374:                 I <- lists:seq(1, N)]
  375:     end,
  376: 
  377:     chk(Chk).
  378: 
  379: %% White box test of persistent_term:info/0. We take into account
  380: %% that there might already exist persistent terms (created by the
  381: %% OTP standard libraries), but we assume that they are not
  382: %% changed during the execution of this test case.
  383: 
  384: info_wb(0, _, _) ->
  385:     ok;
  386: info_wb(N, Overhead, {BaseCount,BaseMemory}) ->
  387:     Key = {?MODULE,N},
  388:     Value = lists:seq(1, N),
  389:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Value),
  390: 
  391:     %% Calculate the extra memory needed for this term.
  392:     WordSize = erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  393:     ExtraMemory = Overhead + 2 * N * WordSize,
  394: 
  395:     %% Call persistent_term:info/0.
  396:     {Count,Memory} = info_info(),
  397: 
  398:     %% There should be one more persistent term.
  399:     Count = BaseCount + 1,
  400: 
  401:     %% Verify that the amount of memory is correct.
  402:     case BaseMemory + ExtraMemory of
  403:         Memory ->
  404:             %% Exactly right. The size of the hash table was not changed.
  405:             ok;
  406:         Expected ->
  407:             %% The size of the hash table has been doubled to avoid filling
  408:             %% the table to more than 50 percent. The previous number
  409:             %% of entries must have been exactly half the size of the
  410:             %% hash table. The expected number of extra words added by
  411:             %% the resizing will be twice that number.
  412:             ExtraWords = BaseCount * 2,
  413:             true = ExtraWords * WordSize =:= (Memory - Expected)
  414:     end,
  415:     info_wb(N-1, Overhead, {Count,Memory}).
  416: 
  417: info_info() ->
  418:     #{count:=Count,memory:=Memory} = persistent_term:info(),
  419:     true = is_integer(Count) andalso Count >= 0,
  420:     true = is_integer(Memory) andalso Memory >= 0,
  421:     {Count,Memory}.
  422: 
  423: %% Calculate the number of extra bytes needed for storing each term in
  424: %% the literal, assuming that the key is a tuple of size 2 with
  425: %% immediate elements. The calculated number is the size of the
  426: %% ErtsLiteralArea struct excluding the storage for the literal term
  427: %% itself.
  428: 
  429: info_literal_area_overhead() ->
  430:     Key1 = {?MODULE,1},
  431:     Key2 = {?MODULE,2},
  432:     #{memory:=Mem0} = persistent_term:info(),
  433:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key1, literal),
  434:     #{memory:=Mem1} = persistent_term:info(),
  435:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key2, literal),
  436:     #{memory:=Mem2} = persistent_term:info(),
  437:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key1),
  438:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key2),
  439: 
  440:     %% The size of the hash table may have doubled when inserting
  441:     %% one of the keys. To avoiding counting the change in the hash
  442:     %% table size, take the smaller size increase.
  443:     min(Mem2-Mem1, Mem1-Mem0).
  444: 
  445: %% Test trapping of persistent_term:info/0.
  446: 
  447: info_trapping(_Config) ->
  448:     Chk = chk(),
  449: 
  450:     %% Assume that the info/0 traps after 4000 iterations
  451:     %% in a non-debug emulator.
  452:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  453:             1 -> 10000;
  454:             _ -> 1000
  455:         end,
  456:     spawn_link(fun() -> info_trapping_create(N) end),
  457:     All = do_info_trapping(N, 0, Chk),
  458:     N = info_trapping_check_result(lists:sort(All), 1),
  459:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  460:     info_trapping_erase(N),
  461:     chk(Chk).
  462: 
  463: do_info_trapping(N, PrevMem, Chk) ->
  464:     case info_info() of
  465:         {M,Mem} when M >= N ->
  466:             true = Mem >= PrevMem,
  467:             All = [P || {{?MODULE,{info_trapping,_}},_}=P <- pget(Chk)],
  468:             case length(All) of
  469:                 N -> All;
  470:                 _ -> do_info_trapping(N, PrevMem, Chk)
  471:             end;
  472:         {_,Mem} ->
  473:             true = Mem >= PrevMem,
  474:             receive after 1 -> ok end,
  475:             do_info_trapping(N, Mem, Chk)
  476:     end.
  477: 
  478: info_trapping_create(0) ->
  479:     ok;
  480: info_trapping_create(N) ->
  481:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}}, N),
  482:     info_trapping_create(N-1).
  483: 
  484: info_trapping_check_result([{{?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}},N}|T], N) ->
  485:     info_trapping_check_result(T, N+1);
  486: info_trapping_check_result([], N) -> N-1.
  487: 
  488: info_trapping_erase(0) ->
  489:     ok;
  490: info_trapping_erase(N) ->
  491:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{info_trapping,N}}),
  492:     info_trapping_erase(N-1).
  493: 
  494: %% Test that hash tables are deallocated if a process running
  495: %% persistent_term:get/0 is killed.
  496: 
  497: killed_while_trapping(_Config) ->
  498:     Chk = chk(),
  499:     N = case test_server:timetrap_scale_factor() of
  500:             1 -> 20000;
  501:             _ -> 2000
  502:         end,
  503:     kwt_put(N),
  504:     kwt_spawn(10),
  505:     kwt_erase(N),
  506:     chk(Chk).
  507: 
  508: kwt_put(0) ->
  509:     ok;
  510: kwt_put(N) ->
  511:     ok = persistent_term:put({?MODULE,{kwt,N}}, N),
  512:     kwt_put(N-1).
  513: 
  514: kwt_spawn(0) ->
  515:     ok;
  516: kwt_spawn(N) ->
  517:     Pids = [spawn(fun kwt_getter/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, 20)],
  518:     erlang:yield(),
  519:     _ = [exit(Pid, kill) || Pid <- Pids],
  520:     kwt_spawn(N-1).
  521: 
  522: kwt_getter() ->
  523:     _ = persistent_term:get(),
  524:     kwt_getter().
  525: 
  526: kwt_erase(0) ->
  527:     ok;
  528: kwt_erase(N) ->
  529:     true = persistent_term:erase({?MODULE,{kwt,N}}),
  530:     kwt_erase(N-1).
  531: 
  532: %% Test storing off heap values (such as ref-counted binaries).
  533: 
  534: off_heap_values(_Config) ->
  535:     Chk = chk(),
  536:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  537:     Val = {a,list_to_binary(lists:seq(0, 255)),make_ref(),fun() -> ok end},
  538:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Val),
  539:     FetchedVal = persistent_term:get(Key),
  540:     Val = FetchedVal,
  541:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  542:     off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val),
  543:     chk(Chk).
  544: 
  545: off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val) ->
  546:     case erts_debug:size_shared(FetchedVal) of
  547:         0 ->
  548:             Val = FetchedVal,
  549:             ok;
  550:         _ ->
  551:             erlang:yield(),
  552:             off_heap_values_wait(FetchedVal, Val)
  553:     end.
  554: 
  555: %% Test some more data types as keys. Use the module name as a key
  556: %% to minimize the risk of collision with any key used
  557: %% by the OTP libraries.
  558: 
  559: keys(_Config) ->
  560:     Chk = chk(),
  561:     do_key(?MODULE),
  562:     do_key([?MODULE]),
  563:     do_key(?MODULE_STRING),
  564:     do_key(list_to_binary(?MODULE_STRING)),
  565:     chk(Chk).
  566: 
  567: do_key(Key) ->
  568:     Val = term_to_binary(Key),
  569:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, Val),
  570:     StoredVal = persistent_term:get(Key),
  571:     Val = StoredVal,
  572:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key).
  573: 
  574: %% Create persistent terms with keys that are known to collide.
  575: %% Delete them in random order, making sure that all others
  576: %% terms can still be found.
  577: 
  578: collisions(_Config) ->
  579:     Chk = chk(),
  580: 
  581:     %% Create persistent terms with random keys.
  582:     Keys = lists:flatten(colliding_keys()),
  583:     Kvs = [{K,rand:uniform(1000)} || K <- Keys],
  584:     _ = [ok = persistent_term:put(K, V) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  585:     _ = [V = persistent_term:get(K) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  586: 
  587:     %% Now delete the persistent terms in random order.
  588:     collisions_delete(lists:keysort(2, Kvs), Chk),
  589: 
  590:     chk(Chk).
  591: 
  592: collisions_delete([{Key,Val}|Kvs], Chk) ->
  593:     Val = persistent_term:get(Key),
  594:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  595:     true = lists:sort(pget(Chk)) =:= lists:sort(Kvs),
  596:     _ = [V = persistent_term:get(K) || {K,V} <- Kvs],
  597:     collisions_delete(Kvs, Chk);
  598: collisions_delete([], _) ->
  599:     ok.
  600: 
  601: colliding_keys() ->
  602:     Mask = 16#FFFFFFFF,
  603: 
  604:     %% Collisions found by find_colliding_keys(Mask) in `map_SUITE`.
  605:     ByMethod = #{
  606:         %% 64-bit internal hash of `0`
  607:         15677855740172624429 =>
  608:             [[-4294967296,-3502771103,1628104549],
  609:              [-2750312253,-2208396507,-2147483648,1926198452,3660971145],
  610:              [-2542330914,-1089175976,-1073741824,290495829],
  611:              [-2155350068,0],
  612:              [1073741824,2807978463,3625918826],

  681:         416211501 =>

  699:              [-22369568,-98812798],[-22369550,-78759395],
  700:              [47792095,-22369543],[9899495,-22369540],
  701:              [99744593,-22369511],[76325343,52],
  702:              [122425143,68],[21651445,74],
  703:              [129537216,119],[125,-110161190],
  704:              [80229747,22369626],[22369629,-55742042],
  705:              [128416574,22369631],[105267606,22369643],
  706:              [22369693,-2286278],[126622985,22369698],
  707:              [22369701,-13725583],[22369728,-22765683],
  708:              [22369731,-54786216],[22369740,-65637968],
  709:              [44739246,12048008],[44739259,-26636781],
  710:              [126966693,44739272],[44739274,-130215175],
  711:              [44739277,15051453],[44739292,17890441],
  712:              [44739301,-72627814],[106949249,44739322],
  713:              [44739323,-56882381],[67108879,-111259055],
  714:              [67108888,37627968],[67108894,-53291767],
  715:              [67108896,-127782577],[67108908,-1014167],
  716:              [82796148,67108959],[67108962,-71355523],
  717:              [67108984,-62077338,-77539719],[126106374,89478485],
  718:              [89478488,85703113],[132215738,89478495],
  719:              [89478515,-122049151],[89478518,-22611374],
  720:              [94050181,89478530],[89478547,42736340],
  721:              [89478553,86641584],[129419863,111848199],
  722:              [111848217,-32493354],[112586988,111848229]]
  723:     },
  724: 
  725:     HashKey = internal_hash(0),
  726:     #{ HashKey := Keys } = ByMethod,
  727: 
  728:     verify_colliding_keys(Keys, Mask).
  729: 
  730: verify_colliding_keys([[K | Ks]=Group | Gs], Mask) ->
  731:     Hash = internal_hash(K) band Mask,
  732:     [Hash] = lists:usort([(internal_hash(Key) band Mask) || Key <- Ks]),
  733:     [Group | verify_colliding_keys(Gs, Mask)];
  734: verify_colliding_keys([], _Mask) ->
  735:     [].
  736: 
  737: internal_hash(Term) ->
  738:     erts_debug:get_internal_state({internal_hash,Term}).
  739: 
  740: %% OTP-17700 Bug skipped refc++ of shared magic reference
  741: shared_magic_ref(_Config) ->
  742:     Ref = atomics:new(10, []),
  743:     persistent_term:put(shared_magic_ref, {Ref, Ref}),
  744:     shared_magic_ref_cont().
  745: 
  746: shared_magic_ref_cont() ->
  747:     erlang:garbage_collect(),
  748:     {Ref, Ref} = persistent_term:get(shared_magic_ref),
  749:     0 = atomics:get(Ref, 1),  %% would definitely fail on debug vm
  750:     ok.
  751: 
  752: 
  753: %% Test that all persistent terms are erased by init:restart/0.
  754: 
  755: init_restart(_Config) ->
  756:     File = "command_file",
  757:     ok = file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(restart)),
  758:     {ok,[[Erl]]} = init:get_argument(progname),
  759:     ModPath = filename:dirname(code:which(?MODULE)),
  760:     Cmd = Erl ++ " -pa " ++ ModPath ++ " -noshell "
  761:         "-run " ++ ?MODULE_STRING ++ " test_init_restart_cmd " ++
  762:         File,
  763:     io:format("~s\n", [Cmd]),
  764:     Expected = "12ok",
  765:     case os:cmd(Cmd) of
  766:         Expected ->
  767:             ok;
  768:         Actual ->
  769:             io:format("Expected: ~s", [Expected]),
  770:             io:format("Actual:   ~s\n", [Actual]),
  771:             ct:fail(unexpected_output)
  772:     end.
  773: 
  774: test_init_restart_cmd([File]) ->
  775:     try
  776:         do_test_init_restart_cmd(File)
  777:     catch
  778:         C:R ->
  779:             io:format("\n~p ~p\n", [C,R]),
  780:             halt()
  781:     end,
  782:     receive
  783:         _ -> ok
  784:     end.
  785: 
  786: do_test_init_restart_cmd(File) ->
  787:     {ok,Bin} = file:read_file(File),
  788:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 50),
  789:     case binary_to_term(Bin) of
  790:         restart ->
  791:             _ = [persistent_term:put({?MODULE,I}, {value,I}) ||
  792:                     I <- Seq],
  793:             ok = file:write_file(File, term_to_binary(was_restarted)),
  794:             io:put_chars("1"),
  795:             init:restart(),
  796:             receive
  797:                 _ -> ok
  798:             end;
  799:         was_restarted ->
  800:             io:put_chars("2"),
  801:             ok = file:delete(File),
  802:             _ = [begin
  803:                      Key = {?MODULE,I},
  804:                      {'EXIT',{badarg,_}} = (catch persistent_term:get(Key))
  805:                  end || I <- Seq],
  806:             io:put_chars("ok"),
  807:             init:stop()
  808:     end.
  809: 
  810: %% Test that the literal is copied when removed also when
  811: %% the whole message is a literal...
  812: 
  813: whole_message(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  814:     whole_message_test(on_heap),
  815:     whole_message_test(off_heap),
  816:     ok.
  817:     
  818: whole_message_test(MQD) ->
  819:     io:format("Testing on ~p~n", [MQD]),
  820:     Go = make_ref(),
  821:     Done = make_ref(),
  822:     TestRef = make_ref(),
  823:     Tester = self(),
  824:     persistent_term:put(test_ref, TestRef),
  825:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  826:                              receive Go -> ok end,
  827:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  828:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  829:                              receive TestRef -> ok end,
  830:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  831:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  832:                              receive [TestRef] -> ok end,
  833:                              Tester ! Done
  834:                      end, [link, {message_queue_data, MQD}]),
  835:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  836:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  837:     Pid ! persistent_term:get(test_ref),
  838:     %% Throw in some messages with a reference from the heap
  839:     %% while we're at it...
  840:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  841:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  842:     Pid ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)],
  843:     persistent_term:erase(test_ref),
  844:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
  845:     Pid ! Go,
  846:     receive Done -> ok end,
  847:     unlink(Pid),
  848:     exit(Pid, kill),
  849:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
  850:     ok.
  851: 
  852: %% Check that there is the same number of persistents terms before
  853: %% and after each test case.
  854: 
  855: chk() ->
  856:     {xtra_info(), persistent_term:get()}.
  857: 
  858: chk({Info1, _Initial} = Chk) ->
  859:     #{count := Count, memory := Memory1, table := Table1} = Info1,
  860:     case xtra_info() of
  861:         Info1 ->
  862:             ok;
  863:         #{count := Count, memory := Memory2, table := Table2}=Info2
  864:           when Memory2 > Memory1,
  865:                Table2 > Table1 ->
  866:             %% Check increased memory is only table growth hysteresis
  867:             MemDiff = Memory2 - Memory1,
  868:             TabDiff = (Table2 - Table1) * erlang:system_info(wordsize),
  869:             {MemDiff,MemDiff} = {MemDiff, TabDiff},
  870: 
  871:             case (Count / Table2) of
  872:                 Load when Load >= 0.25 ->
  873:                     ok;
  874:                 _ ->
  875:                     chk_fail("Hash table too large", Info1, Info2)
  876:             end;
  877:         Info2 ->
  878:             chk_fail("Memory diff", Info1, Info2)
  879:     end,
  880:     Key = {?MODULE,?FUNCTION_NAME},
  881:     ok = persistent_term:put(Key, {term,Info1}),
  882:     Term = persistent_term:get(Key),
  883:     true = persistent_term:erase(Key),
  884:     chk_not_stuck(Term, 1),
  885:     [persistent_term:erase(K) || {K, _} <- pget(Chk)],
  886:     ok.
  887: 
  888: xtra_info() ->
  889:     maps:merge(persistent_term:info(),
  890:                erts_debug:get_internal_state(persistent_term)).
  891: 
  892: chk_fail(Error, Info1, Info2) ->
  893:     io:format("Info1 = ~p\n", [Info1]),
  894:     io:format("Info2 = ~p\n", [Info2]),
  895:     ct:fail(Error).
  896: 
  897: chk_not_stuck(Term, Timeout) ->
  898:     %% Hash tables to be deleted are put onto a queue.
  899:     %% Make sure that the queue isn't stuck by a table with
  900:     %% a non-zero ref count.
  901: 
  902:     case erts_debug:size_shared(Term) of
  903:         0 ->
  904:             receive after Timeout -> ok end,
  905:             case Timeout of
  906:                 1000 ->
  907:                     flush_later_ops(),
  908:                     chk_not_stuck(Term, 1);
  909:                 _ ->
  910:                     chk_not_stuck(Term, Timeout*10)
  911:             end;
  912:         _ ->
  913:             ok
  914:     end.
  915: 
  916: pget({_, Initial}) ->
  917:     persistent_term:get() -- Initial.
  918: 
  919: 
  920: killed_while_trapping_put(_Config) ->
  921:     repeat(
  922:       fun() ->
  923:               NrOfPutsInChild = 10000,
  924:               do_puts(2500, my_value),
  925:               Pid =
  926:                   spawn(fun() ->
  927:                                 do_puts(NrOfPutsInChild, my_value2)
  928:                         end),
  929:               timer:sleep(1),
  930:               erlang:exit(Pid, kill),
  931:               do_erases(NrOfPutsInChild)
  932:       end,
  933:       10),
  934:     ok.
  935: 
  936: killed_while_trapping_erase(_Config) ->
  937:     repeat(
  938:       fun() ->
  939:               NrOfErases = 2500,
  940:               do_puts(NrOfErases, my_value),
  941:               Pid =
  942:                   spawn(fun() ->
  943:                                 do_erases(NrOfErases)
  944:                         end),
  945:               timer:sleep(1),
  946:               erlang:exit(Pid, kill),
  947:               do_erases(NrOfErases)
  948:       end,
  949:       10),
  950:     ok.
  951: 
  952: put_erase_trapping(_Config) ->
  953:     NrOfItems = 5000,
  954:     do_puts(NrOfItems, first),
  955:     do_puts(NrOfItems, second),
  956:     do_erases(NrOfItems),
  957:     ok.
  958: 
  959: do_puts(0, _) -> ok;
  960: do_puts(NrOfPuts, ValuePrefix) ->
  961:     Key = {?MODULE, NrOfPuts},
  962:     Value = {ValuePrefix, NrOfPuts},
  963:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, rand:uniform(250)),
  964:     persistent_term:put(Key, Value),
  965:     Value = persistent_term:get(Key),
  966:     do_puts(NrOfPuts - 1, ValuePrefix).
  967: 
  968: do_erases(0) -> ok;
  969: do_erases(NrOfErases) ->
  970:     Key = {?MODULE,NrOfErases},
  971:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, rand:uniform(500)),
  972:     persistent_term:erase(Key),
  973:     not_found = persistent_term:get(Key, not_found),
  974:     do_erases(NrOfErases - 1).
  975: 
  976: repeat(_Fun, 0) ->
  977:     ok;
  978: repeat(Fun, N) ->
  979:     Fun(),
  980:     repeat(Fun, N-1).
  981: 
  982: error_info(_Config) ->
  983:     L = [{erase, [{?MODULE,my_key}], [no_fail]},
  984:          {get, [{?MODULE,certainly_not_existing}]},
  985:          {get, [{?MODULE,certainly_not_existing}, default], [no_fail]},
  986:          {put, 2}                               %Can't fail.
  987:         ],
  988:     do_error_info(L).
  989: 
  990: do_error_info(L0) ->
  991:     L1 = lists:foldl(fun({_,A}, Acc) when is_integer(A) -> Acc;
  992:                         ({F,A}, Acc) -> [{F,A,[]}|Acc];
  993:                         ({F,A,Opts}, Acc) -> [{F,A,Opts}|Acc]
  994:                      end, [], L0),
  995:     Tests = ordsets:from_list([{F,length(A)} || {F,A,_} <- L1] ++
  996:                                   [{F,A} || {F,A} <- L0, is_integer(A)]),
  997:     Bifs0 = [{F,A} || {F,A} <- persistent_term:module_info(exports),
  998:                       A =/= 0,
  999:                       F =/= module_info],
 1000:     Bifs = ordsets:from_list(Bifs0),
 1001:     NYI = [{F,lists:duplicate(A, '*'),nyi} || {F,A} <- Bifs -- Tests],
 1002:     L = lists:sort(NYI ++ L1),
 1003:     do_error_info(L, []).
 1004: 
 1005: do_error_info([{_,Args,nyi}=H|T], Errors) ->
 1006:     case lists:all(fun(A) -> A =:= '*' end, Args) of
 1007:         true ->
 1008:             do_error_info(T, [{nyi,H}|Errors]);
 1009:         false ->
 1010:             do_error_info(T, [{bad_nyi,H}|Errors])
 1011:     end;
 1012: do_error_info([{F,Args,Opts}|T], Errors) ->
 1013:     eval_bif_error(F, Args, Opts, T, Errors);
 1014: do_error_info([], Errors0) ->
 1015:     case lists:sort(Errors0) of
 1016:         [] ->
 1017:             ok;
 1018:         [_|_]=Errors ->
 1019:             io:format("\n~p\n", [Errors]),
 1020:             ct:fail({length(Errors),errors})
 1021:     end.
 1022: 
 1023: eval_bif_error(F, Args, Opts, T, Errors0) ->
 1024:     try apply(persistent_term, F, Args) of
 1025:         Result ->
 1026:             case lists:member(no_fail, Opts) of
 1027:                 true ->
 1028:                     do_error_info(T, Errors0);
 1029:                 false ->
 1030:                     do_error_info(T, [{should_fail,{F,Args},Result}|Errors0])
 1031:             end
 1032:     catch
 1033:         error:Reason:Stk ->
 1034:             SF = fun(Mod, _, _) -> Mod =:= test_server end,
 1035:             Str = erl_error:format_exception(error, Reason, Stk, #{stack_trim_fun => SF}),
 1036:             BinStr = iolist_to_binary(Str),
 1037:             ArgStr = lists:join(", ", [io_lib:format("~p", [A]) || A <- Args]),
 1038:             io:format("\nerlang:~p(~s)\n~ts", [F,ArgStr,BinStr]),
 1039: 
 1040:             case Stk of
 1041:                 [{persistent_term,ActualF,ActualArgs,Info}|_] ->
 1042:                     RE = <<"[*][*][*] argument \\d+:">>,
 1043:                     Errors1 = case re:run(BinStr, RE, [{capture, none}]) of
 1044:                                   match ->
 1045:                                       Errors0;
 1046:                                   nomatch when Reason =:= system_limit ->
 1047:                                       Errors0;
 1048:                                   nomatch ->
 1049:                                       [{no_explanation,{F,Args},Info}|Errors0]
 1050:                               end,
 1051: 
 1052:                     Errors = case {ActualF,ActualArgs} of
 1053:                                  {F,Args} ->
 1054:                                      Errors1;
 1055:                                  _ ->
 1056:                                      [{renamed,{F,length(Args)},{ActualF,ActualArgs}}|Errors1]
 1057:                              end,
 1058: 
 1059:                     do_error_info(T, Errors);
 1060:                 _ ->
 1061:                     Errors = [{renamed,{F,length(Args)},hd(Stk)}|Errors0],
 1062:                     do_error_info(T, Errors)
 1063:             end
 1064:     end.
 1065: 
 1066: 
 1067: %% OTP-17298
 1068: get_all_race(_Config) ->
 1069:     N = 20 * erlang:system_info(schedulers_online),
 1070:     persistent_term:put(get_all_race, N),
 1071:     SPs = [spawn_link(fun() -> gar_setter(Seq) end) || Seq <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1072:     GPs = [spawn_link(fun gar_getter/0) || _ <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1073:     receive after 2000 -> ok end,
 1074:     [begin unlink(Pid), exit(Pid,kill) end || Pid <- (SPs ++ GPs)],
 1075:     ok.
 1076: 
 1077: get_all_race_cleanup() ->
 1078:     N = persistent_term:get(get_all_race, 0),
 1079:     _ = persistent_term:erase(get_all_race),
 1080:     [_ = persistent_term:erase(Seq) || Seq <- lists:seq(1, N)],
 1081:     ok.
 1082: 
 1083: gar_getter() ->
 1084:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, 1),
 1085:     _ = persistent_term:get(),
 1086:     gar_getter().
 1087: 
 1088: gar_setter(Key) ->
 1089:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(reds_left, 1),
 1090:     persistent_term:erase(Key),
 1091:     persistent_term:put(Key, {complex, term}),
 1092:     gar_setter(Key).
 1093: 
 1094: %% Test that literals in non-message signals are copied
 1095: %% when removed...
 1096: %%
 1097: %% Currently the only non-message signal that may carry
 1098: %% literals are alias-message signals. Exit signals have
 1099: %% been added to the test since they should be added
 1100: %% next...
 1101: 
 1102: non_message_signal(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1103:     non_message_signal_test(on_heap),
 1104:     non_message_signal_test(off_heap),
 1105:     ok.
 1106: 
 1107: non_message_signal_test(MQD) ->
 1108:     io:format("Testing on ~p~n", [MQD]),
 1109:     process_flag(scheduler, 1),
 1110:     process_flag(priority, max),
 1111:     MultiSched = erlang:system_info(schedulers) > 1,
 1112:     {TokOpts, RecvOpts}
 1113:         = case MultiSched of
 1114:               true ->
 1115:                   {[link, {scheduler, 2}, {priority, high}],
 1116:                    [link, {scheduler, 2}, {priority, low},
 1117: 		    {message_queue_data, MQD}]};
 1118:               false ->
 1119:                   {[link], [link, {message_queue_data, MQD}]}
 1120:           end,
 1121:     RecvPrepared = make_ref(),
 1122:     TokPrepared = make_ref(),
 1123:     Go = make_ref(),
 1124:     Done = make_ref(),
 1125:     TestRef = make_ref(),
 1126:     Tester = self(),
 1127:     persistent_term:put(test_ref, TestRef),
 1128:     Pid = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1129: 			    process_flag(trap_exit, true),
 1130:                             Tester ! {RecvPrepared, alias()},
 1131:                             receive Go -> ok end,
 1132: 			    recv_msg(TestRef, 50),
 1133: 			    recv_msg([TestRef], 50),
 1134:                             recv_msg({'EXIT', Tester, TestRef}, 50),
 1135:                             recv_msg({'EXIT', Tester, [TestRef]}, 50),
 1136:                             Tester ! Done
 1137:                     end, RecvOpts),
 1138:     Alias = receive {RecvPrepared, A} -> A end,
 1139:     Tok = spawn_opt(fun () ->
 1140:                             Tester ! TokPrepared,
 1141:                             tok_loop()
 1142:                     end, TokOpts),
 1143:     receive TokPrepared -> ok end,
 1144:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> Alias ! persistent_term:get(test_ref) end,
 1145: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1146:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> Alias ! [persistent_term:get(test_ref)] end,
 1147: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1148:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> exit(Pid, persistent_term:get(test_ref)) end,
 1149: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1150:     lists:foreach(fun (_) -> exit(Pid, [persistent_term:get(test_ref)]) end,
 1151: 		  lists:seq(1, 50)),
 1152:     persistent_term:erase(test_ref),
 1153:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1154:     unlink(Tok),
 1155:     exit(Tok, kill),
 1156:     receive after 1000 -> ok end,
 1157:     Pid ! Go,
 1158:     receive Done -> ok end,
 1159:     unlink(Pid),
 1160:     exit(Pid, kill),
 1161:     false = is_process_alive(Pid),
 1162:     false = is_process_alive(Tok),
 1163:     ok.
 1164: 
 1165: recv_msg(_Msg, 0) ->
 1166:     ok;
 1167: recv_msg(Msg, N) ->
 1168:     receive
 1169:         Msg ->
 1170:             recv_msg(Msg, N-1)
 1171:     end.
 1172: 
 1173: tok_loop() ->
 1174:     tok_loop().
 1175: 
 1176: %% GH-5908: `persistent_term:get/1,2` could race with `persistent_term:put/2`
 1177: %% and return an unexpected value if `get/1,2` happened to _abort_ its lookup
 1178: %% in the same bucket that `put/2` was writing to.
 1179: get_put_colliding_bucket(_Config) ->
 1180:     [[Key, CollidesWith | _] | _] = colliding_keys(),
 1181:     false = persistent_term:erase(Key),
 1182: 
 1183:     {Pid, MRef} =
 1184:         spawn_monitor(fun() ->
 1185:                               Schedulers = erlang:system_info(schedulers),
 1186:                               [spawn_link(fun() -> gpcb_reader(Key) end)
 1187:                                || _ <- lists:seq(1, Schedulers - 1)],
 1188:                               gpcb_updater(CollidesWith)
 1189:                       end),
 1190: 
 1191:     %% The race usually gets detected within a second or two, so we'll consider
 1192:     %% the test passed if we can't reproduce it in 10 seconds.
 1193:     receive
 1194:         {'DOWN', MRef, process, Pid, Reason} ->
 1195:             ct:fail(Reason)
 1196:     after 10000 ->
 1197:             exit(Pid, kill),
 1198:             ok
 1199:     end.
 1200: 
 1201: gpcb_reader(Key) ->
 1202:     expected = persistent_term:get(Key, expected),
 1203:     gpcb_reader(Key).
 1204: 
 1205: gpcb_updater(CollidesWith) ->
 1206:     persistent_term:erase(CollidesWith),
 1207:     persistent_term:put(CollidesWith, unexpected),
 1208:     gpcb_updater(CollidesWith).
